raw_data.vendor_name: NASH HEALTHCARE CONSULTING, LIMITED LIABILITY COMP.
raw_data.title: Physician Consultant
raw_data.description: The physician consultant provides years of clinical expertise and knowledge in an effort to support processes and activities related to health care quality improvement.  This position develops and manages projects related to evaluations and promotion of health care services in an effort to enhance process improvement. They utilize vast technical expertise and experience to lead and direct health care staff in project management.  The physician consultant is a graduate from an accredited school of medicine and has completed residency in an accredited residency training program.   Additionally, they must have successfully completed didactic and hands on training approved by the NHC on the hospital, ambulatory, primary care medical home, Medicare conditions of participation and other applicable regulations and rules as applies to healthcare organizations.
raw_data.required_certifications_or_licenses: Must have an unrestricted license to practice medicine or osteopathic medicine.

raw_data.vendor_name: NASH HEALTHCARE CONSULTING, LIMITED LIABILITY COMP.
raw_data.title: Nurse Consultant
raw_data.description: The nurse consultant performs medical records and claims review to ensure that proper regulatory guidelines have been flowed.  This position utilizes professional medical knowledge to review healthcare claims and effectively determines the medical necessity/coverage of services billed in support of the detection, case development, remediation and recovery of suspected overpayments, fraud, waste and abuse. This position is a graduate of an accredited nursing program.    Serves as a clinical resource for investigators, data analysts, and management. Collaborates with other team members when dealing with challenging medical reviews. Participates on proactive project teams as needed. Demonstrates ability to consistently achieve production standards. Serves as a mentor for new team members as needed. Meets with Investigative Team representatives to discuss review specifics as needed. May serve as an investigative team member by participating in onsite interviews/ audits. Additionally, this position must have successfully completed didactic and hands-one training approved by NHC on a minimum of one set of TJC standards and the Medicare conditions of participation and other applicable regulations and rules as applies to healthcare organizations.
raw_data.required_certifications_or_licenses: Licensure: Must have an unrestricted nursing license.
raw_data.key_words: records and claims review,remediation and recovery

raw_data.vendor_name: NASH HEALTHCARE CONSULTING, LIMITED LIABILITY COMP.
raw_data.title: Pharmacist Consultant
raw_data.description: The pharmacist consultant utilizes experience and knowledge to educate health care providers on various medical issues of importance.  This positions consults with pharmacies to help them improve existing programs, including, but not limited to MTM, CPAs or other clinical services in an effort to improve medication safety and effectiveness, drug therapy and medication management.  The pharmacist consultant conducts assessments and proposes changes based on the assessment outcomes, often proposes process improvements in areas of physician collaboration, patient adherence measures, etc.  Additionally, this position focuses on staff training, organization, setting up systems and automating the MTM process as much as possible in the pharmacy. And assists in implementation of staff protocols and procedures.
raw_data.required_certifications_or_licenses: Licensure: Must have dual unrestricted license in the practice of Pharmy (NAPLEX and MPJE)

raw_data.vendor_name: NASH HEALTHCARE CONSULTING, LIMITED LIABILITY COMP.
raw_data.title: Certified Life Safety Specialist
raw_data.description: The certified life safety specialist position utilizes knowledge of the many environment of care challenges within a health care environment and how to keep their facilities in compliant with the current NFPA, healthcare architectural guidelines, behavioral health design codes. The Engineer consultant evaluates the functional status of the physical environment, evaluates the building or space including how it is arranged and the special features that protect individuals served, visitors and staff.  The engineer also evaluates equipment used to support care, treatment or services or to safely operate the building or space.  The Life Safety specialist stresses the importance of managing risks in the environment of care such as fire risks, hazardous materials, security, safety or utility systems.  The engineer also educates staff on the elements of a safe environment, how to report, what to report and who to report risks to.   Additionally, this position must successfully complete didactic or practice evaluations by NHC with all Environment of Care, Emergency Management and Life Safety standards.  The consultant must also be fluent with the K-tags found in the Medicare conditions of participation.
